Do you want to develop your leadership, future-proof your organisation or update your data policy?

Through a bespoke approach from training to policy review, consultations to workshops, we can help you develop data strategies and policies that work for your team and in your context.

Our work is underpinned by research and insights from clients in businesses and governments around the world. The ODI was co-founded in 2012 by the inventor of the web Sir Tim Berners-Lee and AI expert Sir Nigel Shadbolt to address today’s global challenges using the web of data.

The ODI can help you:

  • Develop your leadership in business or government

  • Plan for future trends in data and tech

  • Strengthen data infrastructure in your sector

  • Fine-tune your data policy

Get in touch

Build your data leadership

Business leaders

Businesses small and large are exploring the value of data as part of the ODI’s global network. As an ODI Member, you can learn from other leaders and become an influential voice promoting data innovation in your sector.

As a Commercial Partner, you can receive even more extensive support and guidance to drive efficiency and innovation within your organisation, wider ecosystem or sector.

Government leaders

The ODI runs leadership programmes for heads of open data initiatives around the world. Programmes such as the Open Data Leaders Network offer a supportive space for policymakers to share insights, skills and leading practice, and can be adapted for country-level programmes.

The ODI’s support for open data leaders has been invaluable for bringing benefits of open data to developing countries. As a partner of the Open Data for Development programme, the ODI’s work is widely appreciated and we hope to continue and expand this collaboration for many years.”

— Amparo Ballivian, Open Government Data Working Group Lead, The World Bank
